intro: Santiria floribunda, commonly known as the white santiria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a fluffy appearance. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Santiria floribunda is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
